src:
S pikadom med
Slovenski igralci pikada gredo na svetovno prvenstvo, Benjamin Pratner pa je postal drugi Slovenec, ki mu je uspelo uvrstiti se med svetovno elito profesionalnih igralcev.
07 Nov 2019, 20:57 by Dejan Vodovnik



FOTO: Guliver/GETTY IMAGES



Ženska reprezentanca v pikadu FOTO: PZS



Mojca Mužič, legenda ženskega pikada v Sloveniji FOTO: PZS



FOTO: Guliver/GETTY IMAGES


Dve slovenski ekipi, ženska in moška, se bosta med prihodnjim ponedeljkom (7. oktobra) in soboto, 12. oktobra, ko bodo na vrsti finalni obračuni, udeležili svetovnega prvenstva v klasičnem pikadu, ki bo v Romuniji in na katerem bo sodelovalo 54 reprezentanc v moški in 48 v ženski konkurenci.


FOTO: Guliver/GETTY IMAGES

Vodstvo Pikado zveze Slovenije, sicer polnopravne članice Olimpijskega komiteja Slovenije (OKS- ZŠZS) z glasovalno pravico, se je leta 2010 odločilo, da začne poleg elektronskega pikada razvijati tudi klasični pikado (steel dart), ki je bil dolgo v mirovanju, zato je leta 2017 ustanovilo sekcijo zanj.


Mojca Mužič, legenda ženskega pikada v Sloveniji FOTO: PZS

Kot povedo pikadisti, je moška ekipa za tokratno prvenstvo sestavljena iz dveh izkušenih igralcev (Mitja Habjan in Benjamin Pratnemer) ter dveh mlajših, nadarjenih, od katerih vodstvo zveze veliko pričakuje (Sašo Vütek in Leon Mertük).Najizkušenejši je zagotovo Mitja Habjan iz Poljčan, ki je pikado začel igrati leta 1993 in ima osvojenih največ lovorik državnega prvaka in je redni reprezentant v elektronskem pikadu. 
Decembra na zaključni turnir
Najboljši igralec v klasičnem in elektronskem pikadu v zadnjih sezonah je Benjamin Pratnemer iz Maribora; zmagal je na dveh BDO – WDF turnirjih evropskega ranga v Budimpešti, zaseda 3. mesto v točkovanju vzhodne Evrope po verziji BDO (British darts Organisation) in 20. mesto na svetovni lestvici WDF, njegov največji uspeh pa je zmaga na septembrskih kvalifikacijah v Budimpešti in uvrstitev na zaključek PDC (Professional Darts Corporation) v Veliki Britaniji.


Ženska reprezentanca v pikadu FOTO: PZS

Tekmovanje bo v Londonu, in sicer v znameniti dvorani William Hill od 13. decembra 2019 do 1. januarja 2020. To je največji in najbolj cenjen in gledan turnir pikada na svetu. Beno je šele drugi Slovenec, ki mu je uspela uvrstitev med svetovno elito profesionalnih igralcev. 
Legendarna pikadistka Mojca
Slovenijo pa bodo zastopale tudi ženske, in sicer Mojca Mužič iz Nove Gorice, Aleksandra Gršeta iz Ljubljane, Jasmina Hartman iz Radelj ob Dravi, Mojca Škafar iz Beltincev in Irena Tretjak iz Slovenj Gradca.RazlikaRazlika med elektronskim in klasičnim pikadom je v tarči, saj je ta pri slednjem iz plute, v katero igralci mečejo puščice z jekleno konico. To je najstarejša zvrst igranja pikada in najbolj popularna v Angliji, na Škotskem in na Irskem. Rezultat se ročno sešteva, zato je na velikih tekmovanjih pri tarči sodnik, da sešteva točke obeh igralcev in jih piše na tablo.Mojca je, povedo poznavalci, legenda ženskega pikada v Sloveniji; s 17 leti je bila evropska prvakinja, je šestkratna mediteranska prvakinja v klasičnem pikadu, 2003. je osvojila 3. mesto v BDO-verziji v Londonu, 2008. je bila zmagovalka pokala Azije v Hongkongu, bila je evropska prvakinja 2018. v elektronskem pikadu po verziji EDU (Europian Darts Union), ki je potekalo v Italiji, in prav tako po verziji EDF (Europian Darts Federation), ki je bilo v Podčetrtku. Vsakič ko je nastopila na državnem prvenstvu, je osvojila naslov državne prvakinje.
text:
With darts honey
Slovenian darts players are going to the World Cup, and Benjamin Pratner has become the second Slovenian to succeed in becoming one of the world's elite professional players.
07 Nov 2019, 20:57 by Dejan Vodovnik



PHOTO: Gulliver / GETTY IMAGES



Women's national team in darts PHOTO: PZS



Mojca Muzic, legend of female darts in Slovenia PHOTO: PZS



PHOTO: Gulliver / GETTY IMAGES


Two Slovenian teams, a woman and a man, will compete in the Classic Darts Championship in Romania, with 54 national teams, between Monday (October 7th) and Saturday, October 12th, when the final rounds will be held. in male and 48 in female competition.


PHOTO: Gulliver / GETTY IMAGES

The leadership of the Darts Federation of Slovenia, a fully-fledged member of the Slovenian Olympic Committee (OKS-ZZZS) with voting rights, decided in 2010 to start developing, in addition to electronic darts, the classic dart (steel dart), which has been at a standstill for a long time. 2017 set up a section for him.


Mojca Muzic, legend of female darts in Slovenia PHOTO: PZS

According to the darts players, the men's team for this championship is made up of two experienced players (Mitja Habjan and Benjamin Pratnemer) and two younger, talented, who are much expected by the leadership of the federation (Sašo Vütek and Leon Mertük). who started playing darts in 1993 and has won the most national champions and is a regular player in electronic darts.
December to the final tournament
The best player in classic and electronic darts in recent seasons is Benjamin Pratnemer of Maribor; he won two BDOs - WDF European Ranked Tournaments in Budapest, is ranked 3rd in Eastern Europe by BDO (British darts Organization) and 20th in the WDF World Rankings, his biggest success being winning the September qualifications in Budapest and listing on completion of PDC (Professional Darts Corporation) in the UK.


Women's national team in darts PHOTO: PZS

The competition will be in London at the famous William Hill Hall from December 13, 2019 to January 1, 2020. This is the largest and most highly regarded and watched darts tournament in the world. Beno is just the second Slovenian to succeed in being ranked among the world's elite of professional players.
Legendary darts player Mojca
Slovenia will also be represented by women, namely Mojca Mužič from Nova Gorica, Aleksandar Gršet from Ljubljana, Jasmina Hartman from Radelj ob Dravi, Mojca Škafar from Beltinci and Irena Tretjak from Slovenj Gradec.The differenceThe difference between electronic and classic darts is in the target, since the latter in cork, in which players throw arrows with a steel tip. It is the oldest darts game genre and most popular in England, Scotland and Ireland. The result is manually summed up, so in big competitions at the target it is the judge to sum the points of both players and write them on the board. she was European Champion at the age of 17, six times a Mediterranean champion in classic darts, 2003 won 3rd place in BDO version in London, 2008 was the winner of the Asian Cup in Hong Kong, was European champion 2018 in electronic darts after the EDU (Europian Darts Union) version, held in Italy, and also the EDF (Europian Darts Federation) version, which was in Podčetrtek. Each time she made it to the national championship, she won the national championship title.
